summary: Edgar Douglas Adrian, 1st Baron Adrian OM PRS 30 November 1889 - 8 August 1977 was an English doctor.
full_text: Edgar Douglas Adrian, 1st Baron Adrian OM PRS  was an English electrophysiologist and recipient of the 1932 Nobel Prize for Physiology, won jointly with Sir Charles Sherrington for work on the function of neurons. He provided experimental evidence for the all-or-none law of nerves.
title: Edgar Adrian, 1st Baron Adrian
